attributes.action: call upon the Secretary of State for Communities and Local Govt. to "call-in" the application to develop 427 new homes in the functional flood plain in Central Chelmsford.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Chelmsford Borough Council have resolved to grant planning consent for 427 new homes in a functional flood plain in central Chelmsford. This is despite objections from the Environment Agency and non compliance with Government Flood Protection Policy PPS25. The area of the proposed development was the subject of a serious flooding following the warning issued by the Environment Agency in February 2009 which highlighted "extreme dangers to life and property.
Not to call the application in would make a nonsense of the Govt's commitment to protect the public from flood risk and make a mockery of the Environment Agency's role as a statutory consultee.
